intro: Arnebia macrothyrsa, commonly known as the large-leaf arnebia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant produces distinctive, rounded, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Arnebia macrothyrsa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
